EVENT.TITLE: Bug Spot
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: Bug spot, the on-spot debugging contest is not only about programming talent but also about applying the sheer knowledge to rectify errors. The challenge tests a programmer's ability to understand and respond to dissimilar codes. The art of rectification / debugging is difficult than conventional programming because it's not about what you know, it's about how much you know and how you apply those cognitive ideas to recognize errors and act upon them. The event tests the programmer in areas of speed, intellect and understanding.
EVENT.RULES:
Programming languages used will be C and Java.
A group can have maximum of 3 members.
Rounds
1st ROUND- Will consist of 50 MCQs related to basic programming knowledge, duration of which will be 1 hour.
2nd ROUND- Will consist of Maximum 10 Subjective debugging questions, where participants have to spot the Bug and suggest a solution.
In case of any discrepancy, decision of event organizers will be final.
Prizes worth Rs 12000 to be won.
EVENT.TIMELINE: < Timeline will be updated 1 week prior to the event >

EVENT.TITLE: Code Rush
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: Do you have the brain of a genius? The online programming contest is here for you. Loose your rationality & let your rusty gears loose, jingle in the disco of grey cells. Show your programming skills and provide the best possible solution you can. So prove yourself on the battlefield and only then you will be a great warrior. After all, life doesn't give a second chance. If you love to code, demystifying the truth or had a knack for unravelling baffling challenges, then this event is best suited for you.
EVENT.RULES:
Please do not discuss strategy, suggestions or tips in the comments during a live contest. Posting questions clarifying the problem statement is ok. If you are unsure, email us at contact@infotsav.com
Discussing CodeChef problems or any aspect of problem, on any other platform on web, on identification, could lead to disabling of respective account and banning from the community.
Almost all languages supported on CodeChef are allowed.
Each program will be tested based on our critical test data. However output and input should be exactly as specified in the samples provided
Please contact aditiagarwal@gmail.com or sinhashivam0406@gmail.com for any queries during the contest.
Judging Criteria:
 All the problems have same points alloted to them.
Users are ranked according to the most problems solved.
You can submit solutions as many times as you'd like, there are no penalties for incorrect submissions. Only your first correct submission will be considered.
The total time is the sum of the time consumed for each problem solved.
The decision of the organizers in declaring the results will be final. No queries in this regard will be entertained.
Any participant found to be indulging in any form of malpractice will be immediately disqualified.
Prizes worth Rs 17000 to be won.
EVENT.TIMELINE: Timeline will be updated 1 week prior to the event

EVENT.TITLE: Techathlon
EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
In the era of increasing efficiency, multitask and reach your destined glory. For all the code maniacs out there who are ready for a coding extravaganza, Infotsav, this year is conducting Techathlon. From an Aptitude test in your own college, through an online coding round, to various onsite events at ABV-IIITM, Techathlon, at every stage, will put your knowledge, skills as well as logical ability to test. It is a 4-event technical extravaganza consisting of:-
Algorithm Writing
Bugspot
CodeRush
Code Stumble
EVENT.RULES:
1. TECHATHLON consists of 4 open-to-all events.
2. The participants should be the students of any IIIT.
3. Every member needs to participate in at least one of the above mentioned events.
4. No member can be in two TECHATHLON team.
5. Ties will be dealt with the scores of Code Rush.
6. The score of each event will be normalized. The contribution of each event will be disclosed two weeks before the fest.
8. Disqualification from any event due to use of unfair means can lead to disqualification from whole TECHATHLON series.
Prizes worth Rs 40000 to be won.
EVENT.TIMELINE: </br>1. The first stage for qualifying to TECHATHLON would be an aptitude test conducted in their own Institutes. </br>2. Second stage will be an online coding event. </br>3. The first 4 teams from each IIIT to qualify the second stage will be eligible to participate in TECHATHLON.

EVENT.TITLE: Hackathon
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: An event in which programmers and developers from around the globe get together and collaboratively design and develop new apps or solutions to real life problems using latest technologies. Learn, apply , innovate and take home a life time experience of becoming a part of a greater community. Make your mark and get your due recognition in industry. Participants need to develop any software product like a web application or a mobile application that is going to be useful for academic institutes (majorly Indian Colleges ) in any way.
EVENT.RULES:
• All aspects of the Entrant Content must be originally created by and solely owned by you or in the public domain. All third party content and content unoriginal to you (unless it is in the public domain) is prohibited.
  • Register for the competition simply on infotsav.com

  • Students and working professional from different institutes/organizations can come together to form team(s).
  • Any identified act of plagiarism will be immediately disqualified.

  • Participants will be judged on their Innovation and Creativity.
  • Participants need to register to the event. Theme of the contest will be announced 48 hours prior to fest. Participants need to work on the clip and present it.
  • Prizes worth Rs 30000 to be won.

EVENT.DESCRIPTION: The main purpose of coding has always been formulating a product to serve a purpose helpful for mankind. Show your vision, apply your logics, type in your code and formulate a product pertaining to the given theme. Choose any platform from web, desktop software or android, and make an efficient product. You will be judged on the basis of robustness, creativity, time and memory complexity.

EVENT.TITLE: Algo Writing
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: An event to test the participants' problem solving and algorithm designing skills. Particpants will be given some problems and will be required to give a pseudo code containing step by step operations to be performed to solve that problem. You shall be judged on the basis of time and space complexity of the algorithm you prosed.
EVENT.RULES:
Round 1
1. Pen-Paper based round.
2. 5-6 questions of varying difficulty.
3. Only Pseudo code is required.
4. Only 50% of the participants will qualify for the next level.
5. Solutions will be judged on the basis of correctness and efficiency.
6. Questions will be given weightage according to their difficulty level.
7. There will be no negative marking for the wrong solution.
Duration of round 1: 1 hour
Round 2
1. Some images or videos will be shown to the participants and questions will be asked on their basis.
2. The solutions given by the participants will be judged by the efficiency and correctness of the solution.
3. To test interpretation and analysing capability.
Duration of round 2: 2 hrs
Round 3
1. This round will be conducted in two phases.
2. In the first phase, all the participants will have to frame a problem which, in the second phase, will be given to some other participant.
3. In the second phase, participants will write a pseudo code for the given problem.
4. Shuffling of the questions will be done using chit system.
5. The duration of first phase and second phase will be 60 minutes and 30 minutes respectively.
6. Judgement will be based on question framing and solving abilities.
7. There will be no negative marking for wrong answer.
Duration of round 3: 90 minutes
General rules:
1. There will only be individual participation. No teams are allowed.
2. The decision of the organizers shall be final and binding.
3. Usage of calculators, mobile phones and any other electronic device will not be allowed inside the venue.
4. If any malicious activity is detected, the team will be disqualified.
Prizes worth Rs 12000 to be won.
EVENT.TIMELINE: Timeline will be updated 1 week prior to the event

EVENT.TITLE: Jobs
EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Placement preparation made fun.
A good campus placement is every graduate’s deepest desire. But one needs to be fully prepared to face the toughest of the challenges that company poses to the candidates before recruiting their best fit. Therefore it becomes essential that the job seekers have sufficient knowledge and are well prepared for facing any test and interview. If they get job in their chosen and interested field, that will be a turning point in their life career. Only the best of the best get the chance of grabbing the jobs. "JOBS" essentially focuses on preparing its participants for the campus placements at the same time ensures that the event as a whole is fun and exciting. It stimulates an environment of campus placements.
EVENT.RULES:
1. There will be three on-campus rounds for the event. Rounds shall proceed parallel for candidates with technical and managerial background.
2. Round 1: will be an MCQ round. Which contains aptitude and Technical/Managerial (whichever applicable) questions to test the basic knowledge of the candidates. There will be negative marking for incorrect response in this round.
3. Round 2: candidates qualifying for this round will get to face a descriptive round of 40 minutes in which they will be tested for their depth of knowledge and their hold on the basics. Technical and Managerial students to get separate questions.
4. The final round will be an interview round. Here the candidates will be expected to answer the questions similar to a regular company interview. The result of this round lies solely in the hands of the judges. Separate interview for candidates of Technical and Managerial background.
5. Candidates are also requested to remain updated with the event updates that comes up on Facebook page of INFOTSAV and Infotsav website.
6. An online MCQ round will be conducted on November 10 which will give a necessary preparation assessment. Candidates are also advised to bring the printed copy of the results of online round at the time of on-campus rounds.
Prizes worth Rs 15000 to be won.
EVENT.TIMELINE: Timeline will be updated 1 week prior to the event
EVENT.CONTACTS:

E-mail: prakhar4edu@gmail.com


Shruti Agarwal

Phone: +91-9407487312
E-mail: shrutiag95@gmail.com

EVENT.TITLE: Code Stumble
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: An amalgamation of coding and reverse engineering skills. A two phase event which requires you to write a complete, working and complex code for a given problem statement in the first phase and then frame the problem statement for the code written by your competitors in the second phase. Make your code tough for others to understand in first phase and understand the gist of your competitor code in second phase to maximize your chances of winning.
EVENT.RULES:
• 1. Event Structure: 2 Rounds:
    Round 1: Coding
    Round 2: Decipher the code
  • 2. Languages Allowed – C/C++ , JAVA
  • 3. Team Size – Maximum of 3 members
  • 4. The participants must reach the venue well before time.
  • 5. For Round 1, participants will be provided with a computer
  • 6. A 15 minute break will be provided to participants between the 2 rounds.
  • 7. Participants must adhere to the time limit.
  • 8. Use of any unfair means will lead to disqualification of the team.
  • 9. Use of internet is strictly prohibited.
  • 10. No responsibility will be held by Infotsav, IIITM Gwalior for any late or lost entries or other such situations.
  • 11. Decision of the organizing committee will be final and binding.
  • Prizes worth Rs 12000 to be won.
EVENT.TIMELINE:
Round 1 : Coding
Objective
Write a program to solve a given problem statement.
The program should run on all test cases provided beforehand.
Time Limit
45 minutes
Round 2 : Decipher the Code
Objective
Decipher your competitor’s code and frame the problem statement for it.
Print the output of given test cases.
Time Limit
30 minutes
Judging Criteria
A = Time taken to code in Round 1. (Max 45)
B = Time taken to decipher the code in Round 2 (Max 30)
F(x) = 4*A + 3*B (Max 270)
Score = (1 / (1 + F(x)))*100

EVENT.TITLE: Process It
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: Machine learning is the subfield of computer science that "gives computers the ability to learn without being explicitly programmed".Evolved from the study of pattern recognition and computational learning theory in artificial intelligence.Machine learning explores the study and construction of algorithms that can learn from and make predictions on data – such algorithms overcome following strictly static program instructions by making data-driven predictions or decisions, through building a model from sample inputs. Machine learning is employed in a range of computing tasks where designing and programming explicit algorithms is unfeasible; example applications include spam filtering, optical character recognition (OCR),search engines and computer vision.
EVENT.RULES:
The winner will be decided on the basis of accuracy. The teams with highest accuracy will be declared as winner.
The contest will be hosted on www.kaggle.com
The teams should consist of maximum of 3 members.

EVENT.TITLE: EMBED IT
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: An embedded system is a computer system with a dedicated function within a larger mechanical or electrical system, often with real-time computing constraints. It is embedded as part of a complete device often including hardware and mechanical parts. Embedded systems control many devices in common use today.

ONLY Arduino,AVR,8051 OR PIC HAS TO BE USED

1)IDEA 2)MAIN COMPONENTS TO BE USED

EVENT.TITLE: Sameeksha
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: Sameeksha is the paper presentation competition that stages brilliant ideas and innovations in the field of technology and management and allows young researchers and students both at UG/PG level to bring forth the novel ideas that they have worked upon. Ideate, Innovate, Express and let miracles happen. Bring an idea and we give you the platform to present it before experts and leading research specialists of the country. Present your ideas which cover the application for technology and management disciplines.
EVENT.RULES:
The rules governing the competition are as follows:
  • 1. The competition is open to School students, undergraduates, postgraduates and research scholars.
  • 2. Maximum number of participants in a Team is 4.
  • 3. The topics that the papers need to be based on are suggestive. It is advisable that the presentation focuses on one particular topic.
  • 4. Abstract should not exceed 150-300 words and the whole Paper should not exceed 20 pages.
  • 5. The length of the paper should be between 1000 and 3000 words, not including the abstract, figures or tables.
  • 6. The oral presentation must not be more than ten minutes in length. Upon conclusion of each presentation, two additional minutes will be allowed for questions, for a total of twelve minutes.
  • 7. Bring your college I-Card on the event day.
  • 8. Please bring your PowerPoint presentation on a CD or in a pen-drive.
  • 9. Soft-copies of the submitted paper and PowerPoint presentations must be in the .pdf format.
  • 10. Please Mail your abstract, paper and PowerPoint presentation to info.sameeksha@gmail.com. Difficulties will be addressed through the same email id.
  • 11. Please bring 2 hardcopies of the submitted paper on the day of the event.
  • 12. Persons from different institutions can be a part of the same team. However, one person may not be a part of multiple teams for the same event.
  • 13. The mail with submissions should contain:
    a. Title- theme of the paper
    b. Name of authors (with Institute’s name)
    c. Contact no. of all authors
    d. E- Mail ID
  • 14. Last day to submit soft copy of your abstract (via e-mail) will be seven days prior to the day of presentation(i.e. entries will be recived till 4th of November 2016).
  • 15. After you have submitted the soft copy, a panel of judges will go through your material and if you are shortlisted to give the presentation, you will be notified.
  • 16. The abstract mail should contain abstract, references, your e-mail id and mobile number.
  • 17. The decision of judges will be final and no arguments or appeal will be entertained.
  • Prizes worth Rs 15000 to be won.
EVENT.TIMELINE: 1.)Round 1: Submission of abstract online to respective mail id of event.</br> 2.)Round 2: Shortlisted candidates from round 1will present there paper before pannel of judjes at ABV IIITM,Gwalior

EVENT.TITLE: Brandsome
EVENT.DESCRIPTION: Advertisements are designed to generate increased consumption of the products and services through the creation and reinforcement of ‘brand image’ and brand loyalty. Brandsome is an advertising contest in which any hypothetical product is advertised by means of various modes, for example through poster designing, power point presentation, video making etc. This contest judges the creativity and marketing skills of the participants as well as gives you the opportunity to blend your creativity with the originality and endorse your hypothetical product by elaborating its attributes, focusing on its concrete characteristics and triggering its demand by influencing the folks.
EVENT.RULES:
Phases of this event:
Phase 1:
1. To participate in this Round the interested teams are requested to send their details at brandsome.infotsav16@gmail.com
2. It is an online elimination phase. The participants have to send their print advertisement (poster) and if you are able to send audio or video advertisement at brandsome.infotsav16@gmail.com . Keep in your mind that the printed advertisement is indispensable.
3. If you are fortunate enough to get through to first round you are eligible for phase2.
4. Result will be published on our Facebook page and the selected teams will be intimated through mail.

Phase 2:
1. Top teams of Phase 1 will be called for Phase 2 which is on campus round and will held during INFOTSAV 2K16
2. In this phase you would be given a domain and you have to prepare printed advertisement and presentation on the same and present your product to our judges.
3. The domains will be provided after the declaration of Phase 1 result.
4. To participate in round 2 the teams should register physically at ABV-IIITM.

Phase 3:
In this phase, we will give you a topic and you have to prepare your brand and presentation for the same, after this you have to present your brand and presentation, and you can play skit which will describe your brand also.

Rules and Regulations:
The maximum size of a team is three.
The number of teams that would be shortlisted for second phase will depend on the number of teams in the first phase.
Teams participating without any unique id’s will not be judged.
The print advertisements should be targeting newspapers and magazines.
Once all submissions have been received, the judging and public voting phases for the competition will begin.
Entries not adhering to the rules and criteria may be excluded from the competition, at the discretion of the jury. The jury’s decision is final and there is no appeal.
In case of any discrepancy the organizers decisions will be final and no appeal from the participants will be entertained.
Prizes worth Rs 12000 to be won.

EVENT.TITLE: COURSE CHASER
EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
The line follower will basically be an event in which participants will have to compete with their line following robots in the given arena and beat their respective opponents in terms of speed and time limits. This basic robot has to follow the black line on the background, taking the right turns. The follower has to complete the race without losing the line. Each team gets one chance, and the team which finishes the race accurately in the least time wins.
</br>
EVENT.RULES:
1.A team can have 2 - 4 members, out of which maximum of 1 can be allowed in the arena.
2. The event will be conducted in two level, and top 10 teams in the leader board will be eligible for the final round.
3. Once a robot has crossed the starting line it must remain fully autonomous, or it will be disqualified.
4. Any robot that loses the line course must reacquire the line at the previous Checkpoint where it was lost, or at any earlier (e.g. already traversed Checkpoint).
5. Bot must not lose any parts in the arena or collide with any other bot during the competitions, this will lead to disqualification.
6. Any Damage to Arena, other team bot will lead to direct disqualification.

Battery and Power:
The robot can be powered electrically only. The electric voltage between 2 points anywhere in the robot should not be more than 12 V DC at any point of time. All efforts must be made to protect battery terminals from a direct short and causing a battery fire, failure to do so will cause direct disqualification.
EVENT.TIMELINE: Timeline will be updated 1 week prior to the event

EVENT.TITLE: BLAZING WHEELS
EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Blazing Wheels is a simple Robotics competition where various Robots would be competing with each other in terms of speed and accurate control. There will be a race between two manually controlled robots. The robots should be controlled via remote control. Each team gets only one chance and the team completing first wins the race.
</br>
EVENT.RULES:
1) Any team can participate in Blazing Wheels, Infotsav-2k16. A team may consist of 2 to 4 member Participants. These participants can be from same or different institutes.
2) Team Representative: Each team must specify their Team Representative (Leader) at the time of registration on the website.
3) The track will contain certain number of check-points and if the bot goes out of the track then it has to start with the previous check-point. You can bring back the bot on track for 3 chances maximum.
4) There will be certain number of hurdles and obstacles. Each obstacle and hurdle will be assigned some specific points and have to be completed in a stipulated time limit.
5) Point description will be disclosed on the spot before commencement of event.
6) One should not use the wires for lifting up or moving the bot.
7) Points earned will be calculated within the time limit and free time of 3 min will be provided. Only once if any technical problem occurs.
8) The organizers reserve the right to change any or all of the rules as they desire. Change in the rules as if any will be informed through e-mail or via Facebook page
9) Any team found flouting any rules would be automatically disqualified.
10) Prize Money of Rupees 12,000/-
EVENT.TIMEINE: Timeline will be updated 1 week prior to the event

EVENT.TITLE: ROBO SOCCER
EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Robo Soccer is a real time arcade game in which each bot is required to put a soccer ball in the desired area just like what happens in the game of football.

To build manually controlled robot capable of playing soccer on an arena specially designed for robotic soccer match.
The robot would compete against others in 1-1 matches.
EVENT.RULES:
1) A team may consist of maximum of 4 members. Students from different institutes may form a team.
2) Bots are not supposed to carry/hold the ball.
3) Ready-made LEGO kits are not allowed.
4) No last minute repairs will be allowed in the arena. However, each team can take a time-out of 1 minute once during a match.
5) Bots would be checked for their safety before the match and may be discarded if found unsafe for other team or spectators.
6) All students with a valid identity card of their respective institutes are eligible to participate in the event.
7) Any kind of intentional damage caused to opponent team’s bot will be considered as foul. Intentional grabbing of the ball so as to make it impossible for other team to get the control of the ball will also be considered as foul.
8) A free kick will be given to other team in case of fouls during which bots of the team committing the foul will be freezed for 30 seconds and ball will be given to the other team.
9) If a foul is committed inside the D-area, penalty will be given.
10) Decision of the referee will be final and binding.
11) Prize Money of Rupees 12,000/-

EVENT.TITLE: ROBO WAR
EVENT.DESCRIPTION:
Robo Wars is a real-time arcade game in which two opponents would be competing with their manually operated robots with the objective of immobilizing each other. The last robot standing would be the winner.Robo war will be held in two categories,namely :-

Mega War - The bots with weight between 20-40 kgs and size 60cm x 60cm x 80cm are eligible for this category.

Mini War - The bots with weight less than 20 kgs and size 30cm x 30cm x 30cm are eligible for this category.

Two bots will fight against each other in the arena. Their aim will be to overpower among opponents and throw them out of the arena, drop into the pit made in the arena. It will have fixed time duration.
EVENT.RULES:
1) The bot will be inspected for safety before the event begins. It will be discarded from competition, if found unsafe, for the participants or spectators.
2)The organizers have the right to change any or all of the rules as they deem fit. Changes in rules, if any, will be highlighted on the website.
3)Violation of any of the rules will result in immediate disqualification.
4)Teams that are not ready when called for battle will be considered to have declared a walkover, and will receive no points.
5)The bot cannot be split into two sub-units. Two distinct parts connected by a flexible cable will be considered separate units.
6)Damaging the arena will lead to immediate disqualification.
7)Lego kits, readymade kits, car bases and development boards are not permitted. Readymade gear boxes are permitted.
8)In all cases, the judges' decision will be final and binding.
9) Prize Money of Rupees 16,000/-
